column4: why do i keep getting :File size limit exceeded when copying files?
even when its as root. is it maybe because of the windows xp machine on the other end?
are the files greater than 2gb and are you trying to copy over smb?
i dont think any of those files are 2gb...
GLOBIGNORE="filename" mv * /some/path
ok thanks a lot
or mv !(filename)
do both methods work with cp as well?
they're both for bash globs, so yes
okies, thanks
filesystem overhead
either that or you're measuring the size of the drive in 1000000000 byte gigabytes
mcphail /dev/hda7 27G  1.5G   24G <- df -h output, thats what im counting with
ah, then that's filesystem overhead.  probably reserved inodes.
ok i see, cause it was quite a lot so i was a bit worried. do you recommend any other fs for a specifically files-only partition?
I use reiserfs, but you're going to have fs overhead with any filesystem
I think the default is 5%
yeah i noticed that after the mkfs output
though there will be less waste on a reiserfs partition
cause i used to have a fat32 partition and didnt notice anything with that...
it's great.  I don't use it because it's huge in terms of code and grub seems to hate it.
ok ill stick to ext3 then, thanks :)
